author: Valeria Castro Valencia
title: Cortes de luz en barrios de Bogot\u00e1 para el viernes 1 de noviembre
text: Este viernes 1 de noviembre de 2024, diversos sectores de Bogotá experimentarán interrupciones en el suministro de energía debido a trabajos de mantenimiento realizados por Enel Colombia en las redes eléctricas de la ciudad. Las localidades afectadas, junto con los horarios y zonas específicas de los cortes programados, son las siguientes: (Lea también: Fatal noche de Halloween en Bogotá: dos motociclistas murieron en accidentes de tránsito). En la localidad de Engativá, los residentes del barrio Villas de Alcalá, específicamente en el sector de la carrera 115 a la carrera 117 entre calles 71 y 73, enfrentarán cortes desde las 8:15 a.m. hasta las 12:30 p.m. En Fontibón, el barrio El Chanco Rural III verá interrupciones desde las 8 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m., afectando el tramo de la carrera 122 a la carrera 124 entre calles 9 y 11. La localidad de Teusaquillo reportará cortes en dos sectores: en el barrio San Luis, de la calle 53 a la calle 55 entre carreras 23 y 25, desde las 8:45 a.m. hasta las 4 p.m., y en el barrio La Esmeralda, de la calle 43 a la calle 45 entre carreras 56 y 58, desde las 9 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m. En Suba, el barrio Britalia sufrirá cortes de energía de la carrera 53 a la carrera 55 entre calles 164 y 166 desde las 8:30 a.m. hasta las 5:45 p.m. (Siga leyendo: Racionamiento de agua en Bogotá: estos son los barrios que tendrán cortes este viernes 1 de noviembre). En la localidad de Kennedy, los trabajos de mantenimiento afectarán a varios barrios con diferentes horarios durante el día. El barrio Chucua de la Vaca I experimentará cortes de energía desde las 8 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m., afectando el sector comprendido entre la carrera 79 y la carrera 81, desde la calle 44 sur hasta la calle 46 sur. Por su parte, en el barrio Timiza, los cortes están programados desde las 7:30 a.m. hasta las 12 p.m., afectando el área entre la calle 38 sur y la calle 40 sur, desde la carrera 72 hasta la carrera 74. Además, en el barrio Dindalito, las interrupciones en el suministro eléctrico se extenderán desde las 8 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m., entre la calle 41 sur y la calle 43 sur, desde la carrera 90 hasta la carrera 92. (De interés: Bogotá: juez de control de garantías envío a la cárcel al hombre señalado de asesinar a sus dos hijos de 4 y 7 años en una vivienda en Engativá). En la localidad de Puente Aranda, las operaciones de mantenimiento también generarán cortes en diferentes sectores. En el barrio Montes, los trabajos afectarán desde las 8:30 a.m. hasta las 5:30 p.m., en el tramo de la calle 0 a la calle 2, entre la carrera 39 y la carrera 41. En el barrio Remanso, se prevén cortes desde las 8:30 a.m. hasta las 5:30 p.m., en el área que va desde la calle 7 sur hasta la calle 10 sur, entre la carrera 35 y la carrera 43. Finalmente, en el barrio San Eusebio, la energía será interrumpida desde las 9:15 a.m. hasta las 4:15 p.m., en el segmento de la carrera 50 a la carrera 52, entre la calle 16 sur y la calle 20 sur. En la localidad de Sumapaz, las veredas Taquesito y Santa Rosa verán interrupciones en el suministro eléctrico desde las 5 a.m. hasta las 6:30 p.m. El barrio Santa Rosa Baja y el barrio Taquecitos serán los impactados por estos cortes. En la localidad de Tunjuelito, específicamente en el barrio Nuevo Muzu, se programan cortes de luz desde las 7:45 a.m. hasta las 5:45 p.m. Afectarán el tramo entre la calle 51 sur y la calle 53 sur, desde la carrera 58 hasta la carrera 60. El drama económico y social que viven comerciantes de la Caracas por las obras del Metro; Distrito se comprometió a ayudarlos Nivel del sistema Chingaza se ha elevado tras lluvias en Bogotá, según nuevo reporte de la CAR; piden no bajar la guardia Vecinos del barrio Ricaurte en Bogotá desnudaron, golpearon y amarraron a un poste a presunto ladrón *Este contenido fue reescrito con la asistencia de una inteligencia artificial, basada en información de la Alcaldía de Bogotá, y contó con la revisión de una periodista y un editor.

author: Kinsey Crowley
title: Rogue wave injures 8 in Ventura, California: Video
text: Rogue wave in Ventura, California injures 8, coastal watches issued in California, Hawaii [Kinsey Crowley](https://www.usatoday.com/staff/12271400002/kinsey-crowley/) [Wes Woods II](https://www.vcstar.com/staff/6965156002/wes-woods-ii/) [Cheri Carlson](https://www.vcstar.com/staff/4406860002/cheri-carlson/) Videos out of [Ventura, California captured the moment a rogue wave](https://shorturl.at/eENOX) jumped over a seawall Thursday, sweeping aside the cars and people in its path. Ventura isn't the only place experiencing tumultuous coasts. The National Weather Service has issued surf and flooding advisories along the California coast and in Hawaii. A video from Ventura officials opens on a seemingly tranquil scene. People are scattered along the seawall, leaning against it and watching the rolling waves in the distance. Suddenly, people start to back away from the wall moments before a wave spikes up in front of them. As it crashes down into the street, many of the people running get their feet knocked out from under them and a truck seems to skip forward in the waves. Another angle captured by [Facebook user Colin Hoag shows the waves chasing him](https://www.facebook.com/1 103854833/videos/339998562146021/) down the street. Officials urged people to avoid the ocean. [High surf is expected](https://forecast.weather.gov/product.php?site=LOX&issuedby=LOX&product=AFD&format=ci&version=1&glossary=1) through Saturday. Rogue waves: [A rogue wave caused a cruise ship tragedy. They occur more often than you think.](/story/news/nation/2022/12/06/rogue-wave-explained/10828252002/) 8 people injured in Ventura, California due to rogue wave The Ventura County Fire Department was called to the scene of the wave shortly before 11 a.m. Thursday. "It ended up being a total of eight patients due to surf that came over the wall and flooded the streets," Ventura County Fire Capt. Brian McGrath said. The injured were taken to the nearby hospitals. Residents in the neighborhoods near the incident were advised to leave, said Cmdr. Ryan Weeks with the Ventura Police Department. The patrons of a nearby hotel were also asked to leave. Roads in and around those areas were also closed. California, Hawaii under coastal weather watch A National Weather Service meteorologist said a storm system over the Pacific is churning up swells. Here are the coastal weather warnings and watches issued by local NWS offices as a result of the storms: [NSW Los Angeles Office - "Dangerous Beach Conditions](https://www.weather.gov/lox/)" - Central Coast: 15-20 foot waves and potentially damaging coastal flooding - Ventura County Coast: 10-15 foot waves and potentially damaging coastal flooding - Santa Barbara South Coast and LA County Coast: 7-12 foot waves and moderate coastal flooding [NWS San Diego Office - "Marine and Coastal Hazards"](https://www.weather.gov/sgx/) - San Diego and Orange County - High surf warning with surf up to 15 feet through 2 a.m. Monday - Coastal flood advisory in effect for Orange County and San Diego County through 2 a.m. Monday [NWS San Francisco Office - All counties covered are under:](https://forecast.weather.gov/product.php?site=MTR&issuedby=MTR&product=SRF&format=CI&version=1&glossary=1&highlight=on) - Coastal flood advisory through 2 p.m. Friday - High surf advisory until 6 p.m. Friday Honolulu, [Hawaii](https://forecast.weather.gov/wwamap/wwatxtget.php?cwa=HFO&wwa=high%20surf%20warning) NWS Office - High surf warning is in effect until 6 a.m. local time Friday. Parts of the islands could see surf up to 35 feet - High surf advisory in effect for other parts of the islands until 6 p.m. Friday. Surfs could reach 15 to 20 feet.

author: CBS2 News Staff
title: chevron-right
text: BOISE, Idaho (CBS2) — A report by the Idaho Department of Labor shows that Idaho led the nation in median household income growth, with a rate of 15% growth over the last five years compared to 2013-2017. The survey compares all 50 states, the District of Columbia, and Puerto Rico. Idaho ranks #1 for highest growth percentage at 15%, followed by California, Oregon, Washington, and Arizona. Idaho still sits in the top 5 when that is converted to growth in dollars for median household income, an increase of $9,153. Trailing narrowly behind first ranked California, which grew by $11,463. The rapid growth in median household income is likely due to several factors, including the population growth during COVID-19, the number of entry level jobs outpacing the number of workers, and the exit of retirees from the workforce. Wages for long tenured employees can be lower than retaining and recruiting new hires. Labor Economist Jan Roeser says that Idaho's increase may be influenced by the influx of remote workers moving to Idaho. Many of them bring higher wage jobs from places like California or Washington but chose to live in Idaho for any number of different reasons. "High housing costs may be a motivator for low wage earners to leave the state for more affordable housing,” Roeser said. “People in the higher income brackets are becoming a larger share of Idaho’s total households with some in-migrating from other states." Idaho is also among the top 5 in housing growth, ranking 4th behind D.C., Utah, and Texas at 8.2%. Nearly 57,000 units were added between the two five-year periods, with more than 60% of that being concentrated in the Boise Metropolitan Statistical Area. The only wage group studied that showed a decline between the two five-year periods is for wage earners making less than $35,000. Groups from $35k-$74.9k and up have all seen increases. High housing costs may be motivating low wage earners to leave the state for more affordable housing, says Roeser.
